net.rim.device.api.ui.component.progressindicator
Class ProgressIndicatorModel

java.lang.Object
  net.rim.device.api.ui.component.progressindicator.AbstractProgressIndicatorModel
      net.rim.device.api.ui.component.progressindicator.ProgressIndicatorModel

public class ProgressIndicatorModel
extends AbstractProgressIndicatorModel

Implementation of AbstractProgressIndicatorModel. This model represents progress where the work being accomplished can be represented by a measurable quantity. This model uses an Adjustment to allow for threaded access to the data model and to allow progress to be represented by integer values. The progress takes a minimum value, a maximum value, and an initial value. Additionally, the Adjustment allows for optional use of a stepping and paging increment to advance progress.

This model allows the value to also be changed by the user. Any AbstractProgressIndicatorController that allows for users to edit the value should call ProgressIndicatorModel.setNonProgrammaticValue(int). This will update the model, notifying every ProgressIndicatorListener that the update is non-programmatic.

This model caps all values at the provided maximum value.

An Adjustment is created during initialization of this class based on the provided parameters. Setting an Adjustment later will override the one created during initialization.

Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

public ProgressIndicatorModel(int initial,
                              int max,
                              int min)
Constructs a new ProgressIndicatorModel. Sets both page and step amounts to 0.

Parameters:
initial - The value at which the model is initialized.
max - The maximum value that the progress is allowed to reach.
min - The minimum value that the progress is allowed to have.
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

page

public void page()
Advances the current value by one page. The value is bounded by the currently set maximum value.

See Also:
Adjustment.pageStepUp()
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

reset

public void reset(int initial,
                  int max,
                  int min)
Resets the data model and changes the parameters to those provided. The currently set Adjustment will be updated to reflect the changes. Note that this method retains the existing values for page and step in the currently set Adjustment.

Parameters:
initial - The initial value for the model.
max - The maximum value that the model can reach.
min - The minimum value for the model.
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

setNonProgrammaticValue

public void setNonProgrammaticValue(int value)
Sets a value such that such that every ProgressIndicatorListener is notified that the update is from a non-programmatic source. This is intended for use when the user changes the value. The value assigned will be bounded by the current minimum and maximum values.

Overrides:
setNonProgrammaticValue in class AbstractProgressIndicatorModel
Parameters:
value - The new value for the model.
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

setValue

public void setValue(int value)
Sets the current value of the model. This value will be bounded by the currently set minimum and maximum values.

Parameters:
value - The value to set the model to.
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

setValueMax

public void setValueMax(int max)
Sets the maximum value for this model. The current value will then be bounded by this new maximum value.

Parameters:
max - The value to set as the maximum value.

step

public void step()
Advances the current value by the amount that is assigned to a step. The value is bounded by the currently set maximum and minimum values.
